title: Foundations of Machine Learning/Deep Learning for Network Intrusion Detection System Design and Implementation

context.prior_knowledge: Basic network concepts and Python programming experience
context.additional_context: Course enhancing professionals' capabilities in designing math-based intrusion detection systems, cultivating practical application skills through integrated case analysis of CNN and RBM models

learning_goals: Learners can explain the integrated CNN-RBM model structure for extracting spatial/temporal features from network traffic data.
Learners can preprocess learning data and convert it into a format applicable to intrusion detection classification models.
Learners can implement and evaluate a simple intrusion detection prediction model using TensorFlow/Keras.
Learners can calculate IDS performance metrics (precision, recall, F1-score) to analyze system efficiency.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
